On Thu, Oct 5, 2017 at 6:51 AM, Etienne Chauchot <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and
> easily:
>
>    - Make sure there is a JIRA issue
>    <https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/BEAM/issues/> filed for the
>    change (usually before you start working on it). Trivial changes like typos
>    do not require a JIRA issue. Your pull request should address just this
>    issue, without pulling in other changes.
>    - Each commit in the pull request should have a meaningful subject
>    line and body.
>    - Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in
>    ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate
>    JIRA issue.
>    - Write a pull request description that is detailed enough to
>    understand what the pull request does, how, and why.
>    - Run mvn clean verify to make sure basic checks pass. A more thorough
>    check will be performed on your pull request automatically.
>    - If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual
>    Contributor License Agreement
>    <https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf>.
>
> ------------------------------
>
> This PR adds the ability to use AvroIO.write() and related methods
> without specifying a schema.
> The schema is determined at the first call of AvroSink.write(): the
> DataFileWriter is lazy initialized (at first write) once we have the
> value to get the schema from.
> This PR also makes the schema optional in ConstantAvroDestination and
> depreciate write methods that take schema as parameter. Tell me if I'm
> missing something that prevents deprecation of these methods.
>
> To use AvoIO.write() with no schema, all the elements of the input
> PCollection must have the same schema, but it is the same with current
> AvroIO.write(schema) implementation because this schema instance is passed
> to the TypedWrite then to the ConstantAvroDestination that is used in
> AvroSink. Please tell me if I'm missing something here.
>
> My only concern is with empty bundles, AvroSink.write() will not be
> called resulting in the DataFileWriter not being initialized.
>
> Please merge the PR bellow before this one because it is used as a base
> for the tests
> #3948 <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3948>
>
> R: @jkff <https://github.com/jkff>
> R: @reuvenlax <https://github.com/reuvenlax>
> CC: @lukecwik <https://github.com/lukecwik>
> ------------------------------
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
>
>   https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950
> Commit Summary
>
>    - [BEAM-3019] Make AvroIOWriteTransformTest more generic
>    - [BEAM-2993] AvroIO.write without specifying a schema
>    - Add tests of the schema less write methods
>    - Fixups
>
> File Changes
>
>    - *M* sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/AvroIO.java
>    <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950/files#diff-0> (54)
>    - *M* sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/AvroSink.java
>    <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950/files#diff-1> (45)
>    - *M* sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/
>    ConstantAvroDestination.java
>    <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950/files#diff-2> (14)
>    - *M* sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/
>    AvroIOTransformTest.java
>    <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950/files#diff-3> (110)
>
> Patch Links:
>
>    - https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950.patch
>    - https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3950.diff
>

It turned out to be a very silly error on my part, failing to propagate `isSplittable`. Please do take a look - `WatchTest` passed for me as did everything else, modulo things that don't work well in IntelliJ. I'm expecting the code is pretty OK now.

Since this is a pretty conflict-ridden PR due to imports, can we go with an LGTM on the basic modules so I can asynchronously fix conflicts and merge?

Specifically, based on this feedback, how about:

 - `model/pipeline`
 - `model/job-management`
 - `model/fn`

These are just package renames from what is already here.

+1 on getting basic modules in to avoid continuous rebasing.

One though: what about

    model/worker-management

instead of fn?

Coverage increased (+0.003%) to 69.579% when pulling **f05b4cce483cfc3718db03393fe117e58d9c8644 on chamikaramj:sdf_api** into **d6c63396a8d27aaa973b0a403c75d62fb09d9c8e on apache:master**.

So far we haven't really had a notion of a worker in Beam - every runner has their own sort of worker, sometimes doing runner-specific stuff. I'd hate to cause confusion there.

I guess I like `fn` because it has to do with invoking DoFns, WindowFns, etc. But it pretty much entails most aspects of execution since you need to fuse and code/encode, etc. Hence my first draft being `model/execution`, but that wasn't specific about exactly what was being executed.
`fn-execution`? maybe that is just extra characters. On the other hand, folks like `job-management` more than `job` (I still like the pithier `job`, personally)
Moved to io/gcp/spanner

To answer your question, no this PR does not increase test coverage, there is nothing more than what I wrote in the description: the aim is just to be able to use `GenericRecord[]` as input, and to read output file with `GenericRecord` Avro API for AvroIO `GenericRecord` related tests.

retest this please

@reuvenlax to answer your question: for `DynamicDestinations` it will work just the same as before: if the user extends `DynamicAvroDestinations` and provides a schema by overriding `getSchema()` for example from a side input, then `DynamicAvroDestinations.getSchema()` will not return null. So in `AvroSink` this returned schema will have the precedence and the previous implementation code will be executed (no lazy init and no schema determination at write time). See https://github.com/echauchot/beam/blob/da95342353bd191c55d6d7768d4c052c531b8cf1/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/AvroSink.java#L107 and https://github.com/echauchot/beam/blob/da95342353bd191c55d6d7768d4c052c531b8cf1/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/AvroSink.java#L140
